snippet: A decision by President François Hollande to back President Obama’s call for a military strike against Syria is playing very badly at home.
abstract: French Pres Francois Hollande's decision to back Pres Obama's call for a military strike against Syria has been received very badly by the French people, with polls showing strong disapproval of any military involvement; Hollande is facing an avalanche of criticism from all sides of the political spectrum.

byline.contributor: Scott Sayare and Maïa de la Baume contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: A decision by President François Hollande to back President Obama’s call for a military strike against Syria is playing very badly at home.

headline.main: After Bold Step on Syria, French Leader Finds Himself Dismissed as Lackey
headline.print_headline: After Bold Step on Syria, French Leader Finds Himself Dismissed as Lackey
